brief_summary.textblock:
Port Wine Stain birthmark is a congenital, progressive vascular malformation of skin that
      occurs in an estimated 3-5 children per 1,000 live births.  Approximately 1,500,000
      individuals in the United States and thirty-two million people worldwide have Port Wine
      Stain birthmarks.Since most malformations occur on the face, Port Wine Stain is a clinically
      significant problem in the majority of patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pathogenic Mechanisms of Port Wine Stain and Repository of Port Wine Stain Biopsy Samples

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine the interactions between nervous system innervations
      and blood vessels from Port Wine Stain biopsy samples.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female of all ages.

          -  Not pregnant.

          -  Has diagnosis of port wine stain on the arms, legs, chest, bac.

          -  Ability to understand and carry out subject instructions.

          -  Subject willing to have skin biopsies on port wine stain and normal skin areas.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant women.

          -  Port Wine Stain on the face.

          -  History of skin cancer.

          -  Current participation in an investigational drug evaluation

          -  Concurrent use of known photosensitizing drugs.

clinical_study.official_title: Pathogenic Mechanisms of Port Wine Stain and Repository of Port Wine Stain Biopsy Samples

primary_outcome.measure: Characterization of Port Wine Stain Birthmark

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
